cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 230 mi E of Tampico, Mexico and 330 mi SE of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander through the western Gulf, then turn north-northwest toward the Texas coast, approaching the upper Texas coast late Sunday into Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas coast between Corpus Christi and Galveston

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf of Mexico coast from Tampico, MX to upper Texas/Louisiana border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible early next week with peak chance near 10%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3 ft or greater possible along Galveston Bay and the upper Texas coast if the storm tracks as forecast
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rainfall with potential totals well over 4 inches, creating flash-flood risk in the Houston area
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous marine conditions in approaches to the port; possible coastal flooding of low-lying facilities
